alert.note: Alert for Coastal Brunswick; Columbus; Inland Brunswick (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wilmington (Northeastern South Carolina and Southeastern North Carolina - Wilmington)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 04 at 8:47PM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Brunswick, southeastern Columbus and east central Horry Counties through 915 PM EDT... At 846 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a cluster of strong thunderstorms near Dulah, or 15 miles northwest of Little River, moving east at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Shallotte, Iredell, Bethel, Makatoka, Freeland, Grissettown, Honey Island, Nakina, Old Dock, Mollie, Exum, Bughill, Longwood, Russtown, Longs, Hammond, Pireway, Ash, Dulah and Goretown. This includes US Route 17 in Brunswick County between mile markers 2 and 18. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
